item.title: Boyhood? Not for these girls
item.author: Abena Taylor-Smith,
item.description: The latest film in director Celine Sciamma’s ‘Trilogy of Youth’ is Girlhood (Bande des Filles), a coming-of-age story set on the housing projects bordering Paris. The title of this French-language film directly translates as Girl Gang – but the English film title knowingly references Richard …

item.title: Falling for The Falling
item.author: Abena Taylor-Smith,
item.description: The Falling is written and directed by Carol Morley, whose first feature film was the moving docudrama, Dreams of a Life. Set in 1969, The Falling centres on a bizarre fainting epidemic at an English girls school. Although this is a fictional account, there are records of similar episodes throughout …
